value.string:
if not ignore_security_check:
 pass
 #if context.portal_membership.isAnonymousUser():
 # # anonymous user is not allowed to use AJAX gadgets
 # return """alert("%s");""" %context.Base_translateString(
 # "This function is available only for logged in users!")
 
 # pass current_web_section (if available so we can send it to server in next
 # asynchronous request and server can set it in context.REQUEST
 from Products.ERP5Type.JSONEncoder import encodeInJson
 current_web_section_url = ''
 current_web_section = context.REQUEST.get('current_web_section', context.getWebSiteValue())
 if current_web_section is not None:
 current_web_section_url = current_web_section.getRelativeUrl()
 if params is None:
 params = {}
 
 # sometime instead of real knowledge pad object we may get just its relative url 
 # and actually that's what we care for
 if not isinstance(box, str):
 box_relative_url = box.getRelativeUrl()
 else:
 box_relative_url = box
 
 editable_mode = context.REQUEST.get('editable_mode', 0)
 # dirty hack to make sure that we catch all possible ways 
 # of setting editable mode in REQUEST
 if editable_mode in ('True', True, 1):
 editable_mode = 1
 else:
 editable_mode = 0
 js_update_code = """updater('%s', '%s', '%s', '%s', '%s', %s);""" %(url, box_relative_url, dom_id, 
 current_web_section_url, editable_mode, encodeInJson(params))
 if box.getValidationState()=='invisible':
 # we can generate 
 s = """invisible_gadgets["%s"]="%s";""" %(dom_id, js_update_code)
 else:
 s = js_update_code
 
 return s
